body.p: To His Excellency Governor Thos. E. Bramlett

The undersigned Petitioners would respectfully represent to Your Excellency that One Michael Hughes of the County of Gallatin was at the March Term 1864 of the Circuit Court of Said County indicted for Suffering gaming on His premises which gaming was done under the following Circumstances ^towit^ Some of His neighbors desired to amuse themselves with a game of Cards at His house Hughes Consented & they played a game or two for whiskey makeing Hughes believe there was no harm in betting whiskey on the game, but the Law only prohibited betting Money, Hughes being totally ignorant of the Law Consented, & thus Committed the offense, He Confissed his guilt & his fine was assessed at $200 -- the lowest amount fixed by Law, He has paid all cost & the Com" Atto fee, but being a verry poor Man, is not able to pay the ballance of this fine -- We therefore Petition Your Excellency to remit the ballance of Said fine as an act of Justice and Mercy & we will ever pray &, &,

Grand Jurors to wit
